intro: Maprounea africana var. benguelensis, commonly known as the Benguela maple, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange-red fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and riverine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks for its attractive foliage and seasonal color changes.
